channel.title: RSCharts - RSPS toplist [project]
channel.description:
I've been working on a toplist project the past few weeks. I've been making quite some progress on it, but I still need some feedback on it. What features are missing? I need you guys to help me with that.
To view a live version of the project, go to http://www.rscharts.com
Again, I'm looking for constructive feedback whether it's negative or positive. Please report any bugs you find.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[b]Newest update: yet another chart added to the statistics page for each of your servers[/b] [img]http://puu.sh/4zEW9.png[/img]

item.title: RSCharts - RSPS toplist [project]
item.dc:creator: @SRBuckey5266 SRBuckey5266
item.description:
@SRBuckey5266 wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Explain how your uptime % works. Does it round or what?

Yes, it rounds. It’s the percentage online of every check.

Vain_:

^ also how often is the ping ?

15 minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCharts - RSPS toplist [project]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“SRBuckey5266, post:39, topic:529229”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=647987.msg4370852#msg4370852 date=1380600127]

New chart added to the statistics page.

Just saying… Voter images like this, honestly, don’t need to be on the site. And if they were. They should be for the server owners only.
[/quote]

All graphs/statistics are for server owners only. That is not public data.

Each server you add to the list has it’s own statistics page, where only the owner can see the graphs/charts, etc.

Made some minor design changes, added uptime %[/quote]
Explain how your uptime % works. Does it round or what?

Read full topic

Made some minor design changes, added uptime %

item.title: RSCharts - RSPS toplist [project]
item.dc:creator: @SRBuckey5266 SRBuckey5266
item.description:
@SRBuckey5266 wrote:

New chart added to the statistics page.

[quote=“Pwnd, post:27, topic:529229”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=647987.msg4363437#msg4363437 date=1379196038]
I would say make the hovering only color, not border/size increase
[/quote]The hover color also looks like turds.

And yes, there is definitely a lot of white space. Think of opportunities to fill that in, while hopefully improving a users desire to click on that content. Give them more options.[/quote]

Any suggestions on a different color/method?

Also, regarding the whitespace: I agree there may be some whitespace; however, I don’t want to add meaningless content just to fill that space. Do you have any suggestions on what could go there?

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:28, topic:529229”]I really don’t like how The header of the site is in all caps, then the nav bar is in all lowercase.
You need to stick with 1 style.[/quote]

I’ve got this suggestion quite a bit. So I’ve made all the navbar links uppercase (you may need to refresh cache).

I appreciate the feedback guys.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461

item.title: RSCharts - RSPS toplist [project]
item.dc:creator: @SRBuckey5266 SRBuckey5266
item.description:
@SRBuckey5266 wrote:

Site is finally back online. We’ve upgraded the server. Should be a smoother experience.

I’m still looking for suggestions that could help me improve the service. What other statistics & features would be helpful for those who add servers and browse for servers?

Read full topic

item.title: RSCharts - RSPS toplist [project]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“SRBuckey5266, post:23, topic:529229”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=647987.msg4363437#msg4363437 date=1379196038]
I would say make the hovering only color, not border/size increase
[/quote]

Done. May need to refresh your cache.

@vain This site isn’t really designed for a mobile device. I may make a mobile version once the main site has been finished.[/quote]step 1 in web design: responsive layout
don’t make a site specifically based on your current view, dimensions, etc. use a CSS framework or write your own CSS if you know what you’re doing.

if it responds this way on my iPhone, I’m pretty sure I can replicate it on one of my laptops with one of many browsers.
@also try making the browser a set size, refresh, the maximizing it. does it correctly show on the little window, and adjust to the larger window? does the sma window attempt to “squish” all the content on the screen (usually happens with measuring elements in percentages without a wrapper)? does the larger screen have the white area like in my picture?

websites should be responsive, and not have a set viewport size. viewport should adjust to the users screen resolution, then show what is needed based on browser size.

Read full topic

http://www.rscharts.com/

[/quote]why is the page so long but content isn’t?

Vain_:

it doesn’t stretch all the way…

null_zps471b4ada.png576×1022

the layout fits perfectly to the visible window, but still exists a scrollbar because the page is so “long”, scrolling over is no ui because the layout (CSS) was written poorl/or because some stupid js error/sizing error
